TLS Certificate Transparency logs don't always talk to you

stories.text:
For both personal projects and at the workplace, I'm running into an issue where there's a LOT of tabular data to display, and I've tried searching around for examples with nothing to show for it. In the workplace in particular, the project I'm working on has an almost unreasonable amount of columns, and our userbase has said that they can't live without any of the columns.

Are there any (web)apps out there that any of you use or have worked on that try to organize or segment tabular data into manageable chunks? Trying to find some kind of design inspiration that won't involve the usual cry of "let's rewrite the app and burn what we have!"
stories.title: Ask HN: Web)Apps that display tabular data in a user-friendly way?
Stop telling kids that climate change will destroy their world
